intro: Fimbristylis carpopoda, commonly known as the small spike sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats, such as marshes and wetlands. The plant has slender, grass-like stems with narrow, linear leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of spikelets, each containing several small, three-lobed flowers. Fimbristylis carpopoda plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
